question.ask: ets_th1 Why do airline companies raise the lost-ticket replacement price?
question.keywords: cover increasing cost tracking missing ticket | rising cost replacing tracking missing ticket | lost-ticket replacement tracking cost more money | increasing cost replacing tracking missing ticket needs covered

std.value: I prefer e-tickets. To start with, they are environmentally-friendly because less paper is used. Secondly, e-tickets are more convenient in that we save the efforts of finding the counter or machine to print the tickets. Last but not least, we can buy tickets at lower prices when the cost is reduced.
std.ai: I prefer e-tickets. To start with, they are environmentally-friendly because less paper is used. Secondly, e-tickets are more convenient in that we save the efforts of finding the counter or machine to print the tickets. Last but not least, we can buy tickets at lower prices when the cost is reduced.

std.value: I prefer e-tickets to paper ones primarily because the convenience it has brought to our life. We no longer need to search our pockets for a ticket in a rush. Secondly, saving on paper means cutting down less trees to save our earth. It is also worth noting that e-tickets are easy to tracking, so that security of airlines is ensured.
std.ai: I prefer e-tickets to paper ones primarily because the convenience it has brought to our life. We no longer need to search our pockets for a ticket in a rush. Secondly, saving on paper means cutting down less trees to save our earth. It is also worth noting that e-tickets are easy to tracking, so that security of airlines is ensured.

std.value: I prefer e-tickets to paper tickets. First, personal information of passengers is better protected. The convenience of e-tickets is accompanied by the possible leak of data. Second, our mobile phone is not always reliable, but a printed ticket cannot go wrong. Last but no least, senior citizens who do not use smart phones may still need paper tickets around.
std.ai: I prefer e-tickets to paper tickets. First, personal information of passengers is better protected. The convenience of e-tickets is accompanied by the possible leak of data. Second, our mobile phone is not always reliable, but a printed ticket cannot go wrong. Last but no least, senior citizens who do not use smart phones may still need paper tickets around.

std.value: I prefer electronic tickets because they are incredibly convenient. They are stored on my phone, which I always have with me, so there's no risk of losing them. Electronic tickets also save paper and are more environmentally friendly. They make the check in process faster as they can be scanned quickly, reducing waiting times. Additionally, it's easy to share or transfer tickets to friends and family with just a few clicks.
std.ai: I prefer electronic tickets because they are incredibly convenient. They are stored on my phone, which I always have with me, so there's no risk of losing them. Electronic tickets also save paper and are more environmentally friendly. They make the check in process faster as they can be scanned quickly, reducing waiting times. Additionally, it's easy to share or transfer tickets to friends and family with just a few clicks.

std.value: Personally, I like paper tickets because they provide a physical keepsake. I enjoy collecting them as mementos of the events I attend. They have a nostalgic value and serve as a reminder of the experiences I've had. Paper tickets also don't require a phone or internet connection to access, which can be handy. Furthermore, they can make great souvenirs or gifts for commemorating special events.
std.ai: Personally, I like paper tickets because they provide a physical keepsake. I enjoy collecting them as mementos of the events I attend. They have a nostalgic value and serve as a reminder of the experiences I've had. Paper tickets also don't require a phone or internet connection to access, which can be handy. Furthermore, they can make great souvenirs or gifts for commemorating special events.

std.value: I prefer electronic tickets mainly for their practicality and efficiency. There's no need to carry around and keep track of physical paper; everything I need is on my phone. They are also more secure since they often come with QR codes or other forms of verification that are hard to duplicate. Electronic tickets can be updated in real time, so any changes to the event details are immediately reflected. This seamless experience is why I find electronic tickets to be superior.

question.ask: ets_th2 What do you prefer, paper tickets or electronic tickets? Why?
question.keywords: e-tickets environmentally-friendly convenient lower prices | e-tickets convenience saving paper save earth easy tracking | paper tickets personal information protected printed ticket cannot go wrong not use smart phones need | electronic tickets no risk losing save paper environmentally friendly check in process faster easy share | paper tickets provide physical keepsake don't require phone internet connection access handy make souvenirs gifts commemorating events | electronic tickets practicality efficiency secure updated real time

info.value:
Listen to the following speaker talking about the electronic ticket.

Passengers may want to have their tickets in hand before catching their planes, but the airline companies are doing everything they can to bring forward cost-saving electronic ticketâ€”no paper needed, just a ticket number and a photo ID card. Anyone who buys a Northwest e-ticket through the airline's computer service by June 16 will get an award. Next time you fly, you can buy another ticket for a friend for $99, going anywhere in the US or Canada through Dec. 12, 2016 along with the lowest ticket prices.

Some airlines offer frequent passenger extra miles for the electronic ticket. And there is rising punishment for paper lovers. Last week, America, Northwest, United, and US Airways have raised the cost for lost-ticket replacement to $70 from either $60 or $50. The airlines insist that the increase in price is not meant to push travellers toward e-tickets but only cover the increasing cost of replacing and tracking a missing ticket.
